    Take a virtual highlights tour of Bowers Museum's featured exhibition, World of the Terracotta Warriors, on view May 24-October 19, 2025. Tickets at bowers.org/warriors.
    Warrior Loose in Hollywood!
    Terry hit the Hollywood Walk of Fame looking for stardombut the real...
    Terry hit the Hollywood Walk of Fame looking for stardombut the real spotlight is back at Bowers Museum!
    Warrior Spotted!
    Meet him halfway! Warrior spotted: Terry the Terracotta Warrior escaped...
    Meet him halfway! Warrior spotted: Terry the Terracotta Warrior escaped again, this time to the coast, while the museum was closed for the 4th of July holiday. Dont worry ...Terry made it back in time for reopening. See him safely returned (and sand-free) in World of the Terracotta Warriors, only at Bowers Museum.
    [+] Show More
    Watch History Come to Life: Terracotta Warriors Unboxing at Bowers Museum
    Step behind the scenes as we uncrate two of the authentic Terracotta...
    Step behind the scenes as we uncrate two of the authentic Terracotta Warriors newly arrived from China for our latest exhibition World of the Terracotta Warriors: New Archaeological Discoveries in ...Shaanxi in the 21st Century.
    These life-sized clay figures, buried for over 2,000 years, are on view at Bowers Museum May 24 - October 19, 2025 and their journey begins here. Special thanks to PBS SoCal for this special footage.

The exhibition was on display October 26, 2024 ... January 19, 2025. This free virtual tour was made possible by the generosity of an anonymous donor.
    Credit:
    Fantasy: Realms of Imagination is a British Library exhibition with contributions from Bowers Museum.
    Further support for the exhibition provided by Solani USA Inc. & Palatina Cultural Group S.r.l., The Nicholas Endowment, Janis Agopian, Elizabeth Nitta Maxson, and Dr M. Linda Sutherland.

    The Eternal Garden Virtual Highlights Tour
    Take a virtual highlights tour of Bowers Museum's featured exhibition,...
    Take a virtual highlights tour of Bowers Museum's featured exhibition, The Eternal Garden: Titanium Art by Aka Chen, led by the artist himself, Aka Chen. The exhibition is on display ...between November 16, 2024 April 13, 2025. This free virtual tour was made possible by the generosity of an anonymous donor.
    The Eternal Garden: Titanium Art by Aka Chen is organized by Bowers Museum. Major support for the exhibition is provided by the Taiwan Academy of Taipei Economic and Cultural Office in Los Angeles and the Ministry of Culture (Taiwan). Additional support is provided by Anne and Long Shung Shih, AUO Display Plus America Corporation, and Dr. Kelly Tran.

    Beyond the Great Wave: Works by Hokusai from the British Museum Virtual Highlights Tour
    Take a virtual highlights tour of Bowers Museum's featured exhibition,...
    Take a virtual highlights tour of Bowers Museum's featured exhibition, Beyond the Great Wave: Works by Hokusai from the British Museum, led by Curator Alfred Haft. The exhibition is on ...display between October 21, 2023 and January 7, 2024. This free virtual tour was made possible by the generosity of an anonymous donor.
    [+] Show More
    Beyond the Great Wave: Works By Hokusai at the British Museum Trailer
    Don't miss Beyond the Great Wave: Works By Hokusai at the British...
    Don't miss Beyond the Great Wave: Works By Hokusai at the British Museum on view at Bowers Museum October 21, 2023 - January 7, 2024. This exhibition includes a beautiful ...early example of The Great Wave and ventures beyond to feature a broad selection of works that Katsushika Hokusai (Japanese, 1760-1849) produced right up to his death at the age of 90. Tickets at bowers.org/hokusai.
    [+] Show More
    Ubuhle Women: Beadwork and the Art of Independence Virtual Highlights Tour
    Take a virtual highlights tour of Bowers Museum's featured exhibition,...
    Take a virtual highlights tour of Bowers Museum's featured exhibition, Ubuhle Women: Beadwork and the Art of Independence, led by the Curator and co-founder of Ubuhle: Beautiful Beads, Bev Gibson. ...The exhibition is on display between July 1 and August 27, 2023. This free virtual tour was made possible by the generosity of an anonymous donor. Ubuhle Women: Beadwork and the Art of Independence tour is developed by the Smithsonian Anacostia Community Museum, Washington, DC in cooperation with Curators Beverley Gibson, Ubuhle Beads and James Green, and is organized for tour by International Arts & Artists, Washington, DC. This presentation of Ubuhle Women: Beadwork and the Art of Independence is made possible with generous support from PNC Bank. Additional support for this exhibition is provided by the Bead Society of Orange County (BSOC), an affiliate council of the Bowers Museum.
    [+] Show More
    Guo Pei: Art of Couture Virtual Highlights Tour
    Take a virtual highlights tour of Bowers Museum's featured exhibition,...
    Take a virtual highlights tour of Bowers Museum's featured exhibition, Guo Pei: Art of Couture, led by SCAD Fashion Historian and Lynda Thomas Distinguished Lecturer Carmela Spinelli. This free virtual ...tour was made possible by the generosity of an anonymous donor. Visit bowers.org for tickets to experience the full exhibition in person before it closes May 14, 2023. Guo Pei: Art of Couture is organized by the Bowers Museum with significant support from Dr. Frank Cintamani on behalf of Guo Pei and the Asian Couture Federation and curated by SCAD FASH Museum of Fashion + Film and SCAD: The University for Creative Careers. Generous funding for this exhibition has been provided by Mary and John Tu with additional support by China Southern Air Logistics.

    Miao: Masters of Silver Sneak Peek
    Now on view at the Bowers, Miao: Masters of Silver is an incredible...
    Now on view at the Bowers, Miao: Masters of Silver is an incredible collection of over 250 textiles and silverwork made by the Miao culture of southeastern China, including headdresses, ...breastplates, earrings, necklaces, and more. Free with General Admission. Tickets at bowers.org.

    Create Unforgettable Memories at the Bowers Museum
